cooking_method: 1. Heat oil in a pan and fry sliced onions until golden brown. 2. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and fry until they become soft. 4. Add fish and cook until it is fully cooked. 5. Serve hot with rice.

1. Heat oil in a pan and fry sliced onions until golden brown. 2. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 3. Add chopped tomatoes and fry until they become soft. 4. Add beef and cook until it is fully cooked. 5. Serve hot with rice.

1. Marinate fish with turmeric and salt. 2. Fry fish in mustard oil until golden brown. 3. In a separate pan, heat mustard oil and add mustard paste and green chili. 4. Add fried fish and cook for a few minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice.

1. Mix milk powder, sugar, and water to form a dough 2. Knead the dough and form small round-shaped balls 3. Boil water and sugar until the sugar dissolves 4. Add the balls to the syrup and cook for 15-20 minutes 5. Add cardamom and pistachio and let it cool down before serving

1. Marinate chicken in yogurt and spices. 2. Fry sliced onions until golden brown. 3. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 4. Add marinated chicken and cook until it is fully cooked. 5. Serve hot with naan or rice.

1. Marinate prawns in yogurt and spices. 2. Fry sliced onions until golden brown. 3. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 4. Add marinated prawns and cook until they are fully cooked. 5. Layer cooked rice and prawn mixture in a pot and cook on low heat until rice is fully cooked. 6. Serve hot with raita.

1. Fry sliced onions until golden brown. 2. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 3. Add prawns and cook until they turn pink. 4. Add coconut milk and cook for a few minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice.

1. Boil milk and add lemon juice to curdle it 2. Strain the curdled milk and rinse with water 3. Squeeze out excess water and form small flat-shaped balls 4. In a separate pot, boil water and sugar until the sugar dissolves 5. Add the balls to the syrup and cook for 10-15 minutes 6. Add cardamom and let it cool down before serving 7. Garnish with pistachio

1. Marinate the mutton with yogurt, ginger paste, garlic paste, chili powder, turmeric powder, cumin powder, coriander powder, and salt for 30 minutes. 2. Heat oil and ghee in a pan and fry the potatoes until golden brown, then remove them and keep them aside. 3. In the same oil, add the bay leaves, cinnamon sticks, green cardamom, cloves, mace, and nutmeg. Fry for a few seconds. 4. Add sliced onions and fry until golden brown. 5. Add the marinated mutton and cook for 10-15 minutes. 6. Add water and let the mutton cook until it becomes tender. 7. Boil the rice with salt and ghee. 8. In a separate pan, layer the rice and mutton, starting and ending with a rice layer. 9. Add fried potatoes on top of the rice. 10. Cover the pan and let it cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes. 11. Serve hot.

1. Cut beef into small pieces and marinate with spices. 2. Fry sliced onions until golden brown. 3. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 4. Add marinated beef and cook until it is fully cooked. 5. Add diced tomatoes and cook for a few minutes. 6. Serve hot with rice.

1. Marinate fish with turmeric and salt. 2. Fry sliced onions until golden brown. 3. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 4. Add marinated fish and cook until it is fully cooked. 5. Serve hot with rice.

method: 1. Boil milk and let it cool down 2. Add yogurt and sugar to the milk 3. Mix well and pour into small clay pots 4. Keep the pots in a warm place for 6-8 hours to set the yogurt 5. Refrigerate before serving

cooking_method: 1. Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices. 2. Fry sliced onions until golden brown. 3. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 4. Add marinated chicken and cook until it is fully cooked. 5. Layer cooked rice and chicken mixture in a pot and cook on low heat until rice is fully cooked. 6. Serve hot with raita.
1. Marinate fish with mustard paste, green chili, turmeric, and salt. 2. Wrap the fish in banana leaves and steam for 15-20 minutes. 3. Serve hot with rice.

1. Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices. 2. Fry sliced onions until golden brown. 3. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 4. Add marinated chicken and cook until it is fully cooked. 5. Layer cooked rice and chicken mixture in a pot and cook on low heat until rice is fully cooked. 6. Serve hot with raita and salad.

1. Mix rice flour with coconut milk and water to make a batter. 2. Add jaggery and cardamom and mix well. 3. Pour the mixture into a greased dish and steam for about 30 minutes. 4. Serve hot with tea or coffee.

1. Fry sliced onions until golden brown. 2. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 3. Add prawns and cook until they turn pink. 4. Add coconut milk and cook for a few minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice.

1. Soak rice and lentils in water for 30 minutes. 2. Fry sliced onions until golden brown. 3. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 4. Add rice and lentils and fry for a few minutes. 5. Add water and cook until rice and lentils are fully cooked. 6. Serve hot with a side of fried eggs and pickles.

1. Fry sliced onions until golden brown. 2. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 3. Add prawns and cook until they turn pink. 4. Add coconut milk and simmer for a few minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice.

1. Marinate chicken with yogurt and spices. 2. Fry sliced onions until golden brown. 3. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 4. Add marinated chicken and cook until it is fully cooked. 5. Serve hot with naan or paratha.

1. Boil fish until it is cooked. 2. Mash the fish and mix with rice flour, onions, garlic, ginger, and spices. 3. Make small balls from the mixture. 4. Cook the balls in boiling water until they float to the surface. 5. Serve hot with tamarind sauce.

1. Clean the fish and marinate with lemon juice, garlic, ginger, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt. 2. Heat oil in a pan and fry the fish until golden brown.
3. Serve hot with steamed rice and salad.

1. Fry sliced onions until golden brown. 2. Add garlic and ginger and fry for another minute. 3. Add prawns and cook until they turn pink. 4. Add coconut milk and simmer for a few minutes. 5. Serve hot with rice.

1. Boil milk and reduce it to half 2. Add sugar and stir until it dissolves 3. Cook the mixture until it thickens and forms a solid mass 4. Cut the mass into small diamond-shaped pieces 5. Boil water and sugar until the sugar dissolves 6. Add the pieces to the syrup and cook for 10-15 minutes 7. Add rose water and garnish with almond and pistachio before serving

Marinate the chicken with yogurt, turmeric, salt, and oil for at least 30 minutes 2. Heat oil in a pan and fry the chicken until golden brown 3. Remove chicken from the pan and set aside 4. In the same pan, add onion, garlic, and ginger and fry until the onion becomes translucent 5. Add cumin, coriander, cinnamon, cardamom, cloves, and bay leaves to the pan and fry for a minute 6. Add chopped tomatoes to the pan and cook until the tomatoes are soft 7. Add the fried chicken to the pan and mix well with the spice mixture 8. Add water and cook for 10 minutes or until the chicken is fully cooked 9. Add cream to the pan and cook for another 2-3 minutes 10. Serve hot.

1. Mix milk powder and flour with water to form a dough 2. Knead the dough and form small oval-shaped balls 3. Boil water and sugar until the sugar dissolves 4. Add the balls to the syrup and cook for 15-20 minutes 5. Add cardamom and saffron and let it cool down before serving

1. Boil chickpeas and potatoes until they are cooked. 2. Mash the chickpeas and potatoes and mix with chopped onions, chili, and tamarind paste. 3. Serve the mixture in small, crispy shells made from semolina or flour. 4. Enjoy the spicy and tangy flavors of fuchka!

1.Wash the rice and soak it in water for 30 minutes 2. In a large pot, heat the ghee and oil. Add the sliced onions and fry until they are golden brown 3. Add the mutton to the pot and cook until it is browned on all sides 4. Add ginger paste, garlic paste, cumin powder, coriander powder, red chili powder, turmeric powder, and salt to the pot 5. Stir well and cook for a few minutes 6. Add the yogurt to the pot and cook for a few more minutes 7. Add 4 cups of water to the pot and bring it to a boil 8. Once it boils, reduce the heat and let it simmer for 20 minutes 9. Drain the water from the rice and add it to the pot. Add the bay leaves, green cardamoms, cloves, and cinnamon stick. Stir well 10.Cover the pot with a lid and cook on low heat for 20 minutes or until the rice and meat are fully cooked 11. Serve hot with raita and salad.

ingredients: 2 pounds of beef, cut into cubes
cooking_method: 1. Wash the rice thoroughly and soak in water for 30 minutes 2. Heat the oil in a large pot over medium heat 3. Add the onion and sauté until golden brown 4. Add the ginger and garlic paste and sauté for 1-2 minutes 5. Add the cardamom pods, cinnamon sticks, and bay leaves and sauté for another minute 6. Add the cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and red chili powder and sauté for 1-2 minutes 7. Add the beef and stir well. Cook for 5-7 minutes until the beef is browned 8. Add 4 cups of water and bring to a boil 9. Add the soaked rice and stir well 10. Add salt to taste and mix well 11. Cover the pot and cook over low heat for 20-25 minutes until the rice is fully cooked 12. Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot.
